alert.note: Alert for Central La Paz; Gila Bend; Gila River Valley; Kofa; Parker Valley; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 10:43PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of La Paz, northeastern Yuma, Maricopa, San Bernardino and Riverside Counties through 1130 PM MST/1130 PM PDT/... At 1042 PM MST/1042 PM PDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Alamo Lake to near Bouse to near Kofa Wildlife Refuge to 23 miles northwest of Paloma. Movement was west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Parker, Alamo Lake, Blythe, Quartzsite, Alamo Lake State Park, Salome, Brenda, Buckskin Mountain Park, Bouse, Vicksburg Junction, Wenden, Parker Dam, Kofa Wildlife Refuge, Vicksburg, Sundad, Harcuvar, Palm Canyon, Poston, East Blythe and Ehrenberg. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 1 and 62. CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 149 and 156. US Highway 60 between mile markers 31 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central La Paz; Gila Bend; Gila River Valley; Kofa; Parker Valley; Tonopah Desert
